text: <extra_id_0> Runx3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and T-box proteins cooperate to establish the transcriptional program of effector CTLs
Activation of naive <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells with antigen induces their differentiation into effector cytolytic T lymphocytes ( CTLs ) .

CTLs lyse infected or aberrant target cells by exocytosis of lytic granules containing the pore-forming protein <extra_id_0> perforin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and a family of proteases termed granzymes .

We show that effector CTL differentiation occurs in two sequential phases in vitro , characterized by early induction of <extra_id_0> T-bet <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and late induction of <extra_id_0> Eomesodermin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Eomes <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , T-box transcription factors that regulate the early and late phases of <extra_id_0> interferon (IFN) gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , respectively .

text: In addition , we demonstrate a critical role for the transcription factor <extra_id_0> Runx3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in CTL differentiation .

<extra_id_0> Runx3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulates <extra_id_0> Eomes <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression as well as expression of three cardinal markers of the effector CTL program : <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> perforin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> granzyme B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Our data point to the existence of an elaborate transcriptional network in which <extra_id_0> Runx3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> initially induces and then cooperates with T-box transcription factors to regulate gene transcription in differentiating CTLs .
